Discussion DC-SIGN is preferentially expressed on myeloid DCs. the polymorphism of rs4804803 was related to the susceptibility of dengue, but it remains controversial. the genetic association studies showed that the polymorphism of rs4804803 might be related to the susceptibility of dengue. ADE was inversely correlated with surface expression of DC-SIGN in vitro. immature DC, which expresses lower level of DC-SIGN, did not undergo ADE. rs4804803 was recognized protectively to severe dengue in a studies from Brazil. the carrier of rs4804803 acted as a risk factor for the development of severe dengue in different ethnicities. it reduced the risk in SCA under recessive (GG versus GA/AA: OR 1) and a codominant (GA versus AA: OR > 1) models in Asians. the different role of rs4804803 in DC-SIGN during dengue infection might be related to the different frequency of G allele in rs4804803 between ethnicities. other factors, including genetic factors, might determine the different role of rs4804803 during dengue infection.
